Good game with a bad monetizing model. Just to clarify, F2P is always bad as it have to rely on microtransactions. I am still voting it positive, and I'm against haters, and unreasonable review bombers. The game itself is great and that what it matters. I still hope the model will be adjusted, i.e. committed players to be able to earn battle passes.

The Game requires you to have a Battle net account, but [u] you dont have to install the Battle net launcher for the game to launch [/u] (The game launches independently on STEAM)

[h1] I Recommend the game [/h1] As long as you stick with game's [b] " Free to Play " [/b]

[b] Micro-transactions and in-game purchases are optional [/b], but the price tags on these in-game cosmetics and content are horrendous, and I refuse to spend a single dime in this game after they butchered the original Cooperative PvE game mode 

[spoiler] If Starcraft miraculously comes to STEAM, I'm buying that and nothing else [/spoiler]

Remember when Overwatch 1 was GOTY?
They stopped trying short after.

I have 4 locked heros.
I thought that Heros over time will be added to the global pool, apparently not.
So I guess over time, my entire library will get filled with locked icons.

When I was on Overwatch 1, I was playing a game.
When I'm on this, I'm playing a microtransaction simulator.

Came from overwatch 1, loved the game. PAID for the game, only for them to take my money and release the same game free to play. you stole from me and only delivered empty promises. you deserve every negative review here, i recommend fellow overwatch 1 players download it and sit on the main menu for 5 mins to tell how you feel about this.

Over 800 hours from the battlenet account, it was a game that has lost its soul and has now become something disgusting

5 minutes of playtime just to write a review for this game is too much time wasted. Anyways, welcome Blizzard to Steam, where everyone's truthful about their opinions.

You can't run away from this one. You've screwed up so much with Overwatch 2. Hope you're happy, especially the executives. :)
